articles.title: Textile units shifting to polyester, viscose - Times of India
articles.description: High cotton prices have hurt the textile industry so much that industrialists are looking to alternative avenues to make businesses viable.
articles.content:
Industry players say that they have no choice but to shift to polyester and viscose due to high cotton prices

articles.title: Mumbai's Carmichael Road bungalow sold for Rs 220 crore - Times of India
articles.description: A Parsi-owned bungalow on Carmichael Road in south Mumbai has been sold to BGH Properties, an Aditya Birla Group company, for Rs 220 crore.
articles.content:
The half-acre property called Sunny Ville belonged to a Parsi woman, Ernevaz Kharshedji Dubash, who passed away in 2013
